Package: io.vertx.groovy.core.eventbus

[Groovy] Class EventBus

    • io.vertx.groovy.core.eventbus.EventBus
    • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
      Measured

      @CompileStatic
class EventBus

      A Vert.x event-bus is a light-weight distributed messaging system which allows different parts of your application, or different applications and services to communicate with each in a loosely coupled way.

      An event-bus supports publish-subscribe messaging, point-to-point messaging and request-response messaging.

      Message delivery is best-effort and messages can be lost if failure of all or part of the event bus occurs.

      Please refer to the documentation for more information on the event bus.

      • Method Detail

        • void close(Handler<AsyncResult<Void>> completionHandler)

          Close the event bus and release any resources held

          Parameters:
          completionHandler - may be null

        • MessageConsumer<T> consumer(String address)

          Create a message consumer against the specified address.

          The returned consumer is not yet registered at the address, registration will be effective when MessageConsumer.handler is called.

          Returns:
          the event bus message consumer
          Parameters:
          address - the address that it will register it at

        • MessageConsumer<T> consumer(String address, Handler<Message<T>> handler)

          Create a consumer and register it against the specified address.

          Returns:
          the event bus message consumer
          Parameters:
          address - the address that will register it at
          handler - the handler that will process the received messages

        • Object getDelegate()

        • MessageConsumer<T> localConsumer(String address)

          Like EventBus.consumer but the address won't be propagated across the cluster.

          Returns:
          the event bus message consumer
          Parameters:
          address - the address to register it at

        • MessageConsumer<T> localConsumer(String address, Handler<Message<T>> handler)

          Like EventBus.consumer but the address won't be propagated across the cluster.

          Returns:
          the event bus message consumer
          Parameters:
          address - the address that will register it at
          handler - the handler that will process the received messages

        • String metricBaseName()

          The metric base name

          Returns:
          the metric base name

        • EventBus publish(String address, Object message)

          Publish a message.

          The message will be delivered to all handlers registered to the address.

          Returns:
          a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently
          Parameters:
          address - the address to publish it to
          message - the message, may be null

        • EventBus publish(String address, Object message, Map<String, Object> options)

          Like EventBus.publish but specifying options that can be used to configure the delivery.

          Returns:
          a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently
          Parameters:
          address - the address to publish it to
          message - the message, may be null
          options - the delivery options (see DeliveryOptions)

        • MessageProducer<T> publisher(String address)

          Create a message publisher against the specified address.

          The returned publisher will invoke the EventBus.publish method when the stream WriteStream.write method is called with the publisher address and the provided data.

          Returns:
          The publisher
          Parameters:
          address - The address to publish it to

        • MessageProducer<T> publisher(String address, Map<String, Object> options)

          Like EventBus.publisher but specifying delivery options that will be used for configuring the delivery of the message.

          Returns:
          The publisher
          Parameters:
          address - the address to publish it to
          options - the delivery options (see DeliveryOptions)

        • EventBus send(String address, Object message)

          Sends a message.

          The message will be delivered to at most one of the handlers registered to the address.

          Returns:
          a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently
          Parameters:
          address - the address to send it to
          message - the message, may be null

        • EventBus send(String address, Object message, Handler<AsyncResult<Message<T>>> replyHandler)

          Like EventBus.send but specifying a replyHandler that will be called if the recipient subsequently replies to the message.

          Returns:
          a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently
          Parameters:
          address - the address to send it to
          message - the message, may be null
          replyHandler - reply handler will be called when any reply from the recipient is received, may be null

        • EventBus send(String address, Object message, Map<String, Object> options)

          Like EventBus.send but specifying options that can be used to configure the delivery.

          Returns:
          a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently
          Parameters:
          address - the address to send it to
          message - the message, may be null
          options - delivery options (see DeliveryOptions)

        • EventBus send(String address, Object message, Map<String, Object> options, Handler<AsyncResult<Message<T>>> replyHandler)

          Like EventBus.send but specifying a replyHandler that will be called if the recipient subsequently replies to the message.

          Returns:
          a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently
          Parameters:
          address - the address to send it to
          message - the message, may be null
          options - delivery options (see DeliveryOptions)
          replyHandler - reply handler will be called when any reply from the recipient is received, may be null

        • MessageProducer<T> sender(String address)

          Create a message sender against the specified address.

          The returned sender will invoke the EventBus.send method when the stream WriteStream.write method is called with the sender address and the provided data.

          Returns:
          The sender
          Parameters:
          address - the address to send it to

        • MessageProducer<T> sender(String address, Map<String, Object> options)

          Like EventBus.sender but specifying delivery options that will be used for configuring the delivery of the message.

          Returns:
          The sender
          Parameters:
          address - the address to send it to
          options - the delivery options (see DeliveryOptions)
